0.title: Undergraduate Research Support Application (2020)
0.description:
Application form through which students apply to be an Auvil Fellow, DeVlieg Fellow, Carson Fellow, or WSU LSAMP Research Fellow.

Note: the deadline for submission of this form is Saturday, February 15, 2020.

fields.label: Award Intro HTML Block
fields.content:
Thanks to many generous supporters, the WSU Office of Undergraduate Research and WSU LSAMP program award scholarships for an academic year (i.e., fall and spring semesters†) to students engaging in independent and mentored undergraduate research, scholarship, and creative activities. Scholarship awards will be paid directly into the student account of each recipient.

General Eligibility Criteria

Though each scholarship has its own eligibility criteria, there are several criteria that each award has in common. Generally, an eligible applicant for these awards must:

  • Plan to be a current WSU student at the time the award is funded, which will be the August following submission of the application in February. (I.e., students who graduate prior to the funding of awards in August are not eligible to receive an award.)
  • Submit this completed online application by Saturday, February 15, 2020.
  • Have identified a WSU research mentor who will be able to submit a letter of reference supporting your application by Saturday, February 22, 2020.
  • Recipients must apply to present at and participate in SURCA

†Note: No awards for summer research are made from the WSU Office of Undergraduate Research.

An asterisk (*) indicates a required field. Please contact daniel.rieck@wsu.edu if you need assistance with filling out this application form.

fields.label: Contact Phone
fields.description: Enter a number that you answer dependably, and/or check messages at.

fields.label: Contact Email
fields.description: Enter your official WSU email address (e.g., jordan.doe@wsu.edu).

fields.label: Scholarship Specifications HTML Block
fields.content:
To indicate which award(s) you are applying for, please select one or more scholarship/fellowship from the selections below. Please check your eligibility before selecting a scholarship.

Auvil Scholars Fellowship

  • Open to all undergraduates
  • Open to all majors on all campuses
  • Preference given to new researchers

Carson Undergraduate Research Excellence Award

  • Preference given to juniors, seniors
  • Open to all majors on all campuses

DeVlieg Foundation Award

  • Open to sophomores, juniors
  • Major must be in Voiland College of Engineering and Architecture
  • Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Research project must be in area of renewable energy

WSU LSAMP Research Award

  • Open to STEM majors who are underrepresented minority students
  • Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Recipients must actively participate in LSAMP programs

fields.label: Scholarship Selections

choices.text: Scott and Linda Carson Undergraduate Research Excellence Award
choices.value: Scott and Linda Carson Undergraduate Research Excellence Award

fields.description: After first checking your eligibility (see above), indicate which awards you are applying for.

choices.value: Freshman (I will have less than 30 credit hours)

choices.text: Sophomore (I will have 30 to 59 credit hours)
choices.value: Sophomore (I will have 30 to 59 credit hours)

choices.text: Junior (I will have  60 to 89 credit hours)
choices.value: Junior (I will have  60 to 89 credit hours)

choices.text: Senior (I will have 90 or more credit hours)
choices.value: Senior (I will have 90 or more credit hours)

fields.label: WSU Major(s)
fields.description: Select the academic major(s) you are studying (or plan to study) at WSU. (Note: The list of majors below is taken from the WSU Admissions website.)

fields.label: WSU Mentor HTML Block
fields.content: An email requesting a letter of recommendation will be sent to your WSU research mentor who is or will be supervising you in your research, scholarship, or creative activities. You should have already discussed this application with this person.

fields.label: Mentor's Email
fields.description: Enter the email of your WSU research mentor, whom we will contact to request a letter of recommendation.

fields.label: Responsibilities
fields.placeholder: (e.g. Lab Technician / Ran experiments on... or Graphic Designer / Created graphics for...)

fields.label: Describe the undergraduate research, scholarship, or creative activities project you plan to work on with your mentor.
fields.description: Be sure to discuss the importance of your project to your field and society and the impact you expect your work to have.

fields.label: Why are you interested in conducting research, scholarship, or creative activities at WSU?
fields.description: Be sure to discuss how pursuing these as an undergraduate at WSU aligns with your career goals.

0.schedulePendingMessage: The application for 2020 Undergraduate Research Awards has not yet opened. The application should open in mid November—check back soon! You can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.
0.scheduleMessage: The application for 2020 Undergraduate Research Awards is now closed. The deadline was Saturday, February 15, 2020. You can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Form Successfully Submitted

Thank you for your application, {Student Full Name (First):4.3}, which has been successfully submitted. You will soon be receiving a confirmation email at {Email:14} from ug.research@wsu.edu, whom you can contact with further questions. We will also be contacting your WSU mentor {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (First):20.3} {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (Last):20.6} at their email address {Mentor\'s Email:21} regarding a recommendation letter.

{all_fields}

notifications.name: WSU Mentor Notification
notifications.subject: Request for a letter of recommendation supporting {Student Full Name (First):4.3} {Student Full Name (Last):4.6}
notifications.message: Dear {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (First):20.3}: This is an automated message being sent to notify you that {Student Full Name (First):4.3} {Student Full Name (Last):4.6} wishes to have you send a letter of recommendation supporting his or her application for Undergraduate Research Awards from our office. Please submit your letter of recommendation by Saturday, February 22, 2020 using our online form: https://undergraduateresearch.wsu.edu/funding/undergraduate-research-awards/letters-of-recommendation/ The student has made the following scholarship selections in their application: {:9:value}. Information about these scholarships is available on the undergraduate research website. Through the generosity of many private donations and in partnership with the NSF-funded WSU LSAMP program, the Office of Undergraduate Research at Washington State University is sponsoring independent undergraduate research, scholarship, or creative activity projects that are supervised by a WSU faculty or staff member. It was indicated in the application submitted by {Student Full Name (First):4.3} that you are his or her mentor, hence the reason for this request. In preparing your letter of recommendation for {Student Full Name (First):4.3}, please submit your letter by Saturday, February 22, 2020. Thank you for your support. Shelley Pressley Director, Office of Undergraduate Research Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement (DAESA) at Washington State University ug.research@wsu.edu 509-335-0014

notifications.name: Successful Form Submission
notifications.subject: Your submission of an application for undergraduate research awards was successful
notifications.message: Dear {Student Full Name (First):4.3}: We have successfully received your application for the following undergraduate research awards: {:9:value}. Thank you for your submission. Your WSU mentor, {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (First):20.3} {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (Last):20.6}, will be contacted shortly at {Mentor\'s Email:21} to request a recommendation letter. We will be in touch with you in the future regarding the status of your application. Sincerely, Shelley Pressley Director, Office of Undergraduate Research Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement (DAESA) at Washington State University ug.research@wsu.edu 509-335-0014
